sourceMeaningMnemonic: A <radical>shellfish</radical> with a <radical>knife</radical> makes all the <kanji>rule</kanji>s. It isn't supposed to be making rules, but it has a knife, so who's going to argue?
meaningInfo: Picture a shellfish wielding a knife and shouting out new rules to all of the nervous people standing around it.
readingMnemonic: The first <kanji>rule</kanji> the shellfish enacts is that all humans take off their <reading>sock</reading>s (<ja>そく</ja>) and give them to him. Hmm... is this some kind of nasty shellfish? Who would want socks?
readingInfo: Once everyone follows the rule, and the shellfish is on top of a pile of socks, he cackles, "It's easier to stab your toes with my knife now! Let's get to more rules!"
